criteria.question: Participation of women and men in project identification

sub_criteria.question: Has the project consulted women and men on the problem or issue that the intervention must solve and on the development of the solution?
Have women’s inputs been considered in the design of the project?
Are both women and men seen as stakeholders, partners, or agents of change in the project design?

criteria.question: Collection of sex-disaggregated data and gender-related information prior to project design

sub_criteria.question: Has the project tapped sex-disaggregated data and gender-related information from secondary and primary sources at the project identification stage? OR, does the project document include sex- disaggregated and gender information in the analysis of the development issue or problem?

criteria.question: Conduct of gender analysis and identification of gender issues

sub_criteria.question: Has gender analysis been done to identify gender issues prior to project design? OR, does the discussion of development issues in the project document include gender issues that the project must address?

criteria.question: Gender equality goals, outcomes, and outputs

sub_criteria.question: Do project objectives explicitly refer to women and men (including adolescents) as clients and/or health providers?
Does the project have gender equality outputs or outcomes?

criteria.question: Matching of strategies with gender issues

sub_criteria.question: Do the strategies match the gender issues and gender equality goals that have been identified? That is, will the activities or interventions reduce gender gaps and inequalities?

name: Gender Analysis of the Designed Project

criteria.question: Gender analysis of the designed project

sub_criteria.question: Gender division of labor
Does the project address the different health needs of females and males?
Has consideration been given to how women may be supported in their role of providing healthcare to the household and to the community?
Access to and control of resources
Has the project incorporated existing health services and health providers?
Are women-to-women services provided in the project design?
Constraints
Are there cultural constraints on health measures that the project will be introducing?
Has the project considered the financial costs of participation that may restrict attendance of females or males?

Does the project include gender equality targets and indicators for welfare, access, consciousness raising, participation, and control? Examples of gender differences that may be monitored: 1. Utilization of health services 2. Mortality and morbidity rates among children and adults 3. Participation in training and similar project activities, by type of training or activity 4. Representation in health boards and similar health decision-making bodies 5. Participation in reproductive health programs and services 6. Employment generated by the project
Does the proposed project monitoring framework or plan include the collection of sex-disaggregated data?
Is the budget allotted by the project sufficient for gender equality promotion or integration?

Does the project have the expertise to integrate GAD or promote gender equality and women’s empowerment? OR, will the project invest in building capacity for integrating GAD or promoting gender equality?

criteria.question: Relationship with the agency’s GAD efforts

sub_criteria.question: Will the project build on or strengthen agency/ PCW/government’s commitment to the advancement of women?
Does the project have an exit plan that will ensure the sustainability of GAD efforts and benefits?
Will the project build on the initiatives or actions of other organizations in the area?
